channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: Nintendo sues Bowser for violating copyright with Switch hacks
item.description: Nintendo is suing Bowser (that is, Gary Bowser) for allegedly violating copyright by selling Switch hacks.

item.title: 'Roblox' will use content ratings to help limit access to sexual material
item.description: 'Roblox' creators have promised a content rating system that will help prevent kids from seeing sexual activity in games on the platform.

item.title: NASA will attempt to fly its Mars helicopter on April 19th
item.description: NASA now expects to fly its Mars helicopter Ingenuity no earlier than April 19th, with live coverage that morning.

item.title: Chrome 90 will let you share links to highlighted text
item.description: Google has started rolling out a feature for Chrome 90, which will allow you to create a link that takes people straight to the part of a page you highlighted.

item.title: Washington state votes to ban new gas car sales by 2030
item.description: Washington state has voted for a measure that will ban sales of gas-powered cars by 2030, years before California.

item.title: Peloton opposes US demand for Tread+ recall following child injuries
item.description: Peloton is fighting US demands for a Tread+ recall after reports of numerous injuries to children, including one death.

item.title: Hitting the Books: How Planck's 'chain of tiny beads' helps explain why lightbulbs work
item.description: 'Einstein's Fridge' author Paul Sen explores the works and quirks of the pioneering researchers — from Lord Kelvin and James Joule to Emmy Noether, Alan Turing, and Stephen Hawking — who sought to understand how heat helped shape the known universe.

item.title: Studio SWEAT delivers a gym experience to your home for $99
item.description: With a one-year subscription to Studio SWEAT onDemand, you get access to a massive list of live and pre-recorded fitness classes. You’ll join thousands of other members who are working out remotely while still enjoying the full gym experience.

item.title: iRobot's Roomba i7+ with clean base is $200 off at Wellbots
item.description: Save big on iRobot's Roomba i7+ and i9+ robot vacuums at Wellbots.

item.title: The Morning After: SpaceX's Starship secures a lunar lander deal with NASA
item.description: SpaceX got good news on Friday, and we're preparing for the Apple spring event on Tuesday

item.title: Edward Snowden's NFT sold for $5.5 million at auction for charity
item.description: Edward Snowden's NFT has sold for a whopping 2,224 Etherium or around $5.5 million at an auction that lasted for a day.

item.title: Ingenuity Mars Helicopter completes a 'spin test,' moves closer to flight
item.description: Completing a spin test means the Ingenuity Mars copter could be a step closer to its first flight.

item.title: Acclaimed 'Skyrim' mod 'The Forgotten City' hits consoles and PC this summer
item.description: It's an updated, standalone version of the award-winning mystery experience.

item.title: Yes, Twitter was down -- at least on the East Coast (updated)
item.description: Twitter is down for some people, if not everyone.

item.title: Valve Anti-Cheat’s permanent bans no longer apply to Valve events
item.description: Valve is making a single but significant exception to how it will enforce cheating bans moving forward.

item.title: Amazon delivery drivers may soon assemble furniture and install appliances
item.description: Amazon is reportedly preparing to test a service where it would both deliver and installs furniture and appliances for customers.

item.title: Facebook's 'Supreme Court' is about to face its first big test
item.description: The Oversight Board, Facebook's 'Supreme Court,' is getting ready for the most consequential decision in its short existence.

item.title: SpaceX wins NASA's Artemis lunar lander contract
item.description: Elon Musk's company will take astronauts to the Moon for the first time since 1972.

item.title: Lego hints at an upcoming Luigi-themed set with a clever update
item.description: In what will likely go down as one of the most clever marketing campaigns in recent memory, Lego’s electronic Super Mario has started to hint at Luigi getting his own set following a recent firmware update.

item.title: Facebook’s Oversight Board has delayed its decision on Trump’s suspension
item.description: The board needs more time to review the thousands of public comments it received.

item.title: Apple Music pays a penny per stream, double Spotify's rate
item.description: But Spotify users typically stream more songs, leading to higher payouts overall.

item.title: This week's best deals: $20 off Google's Nest Audio and more
item.description: Here are this week's best tech deals, including $20 off Google's Nest Audio smart speaker and more than $50 off Apple's AirPods Pro.

item.title: Fitbit is reportedly working on a 'luxury' fitness tracker
item.description: A leak may have revealed the Fitbit Luxe, an upscale fitness tracker for those who want fashion without a smartwatch.

item.title: ASUS Zephyrus G15 review (2021): All the gaming laptop you need
item.description: The ASUS Zephyrus G15 has almost everything we'd want in a gaming laptop.

item.title: Livestorm is the Zoom alternative you didn’t know you needed
item.description: It turns out, video conferencing can actually be enjoyable
